title: Variables and Data Types
description: Learn about different data types and how to store data in variables

sections.title: What are Variables?
sections.content: Variables are like labeled boxes where we can store different types of information. Just like you might have a box labeled 'toys' to store your toys, programmers use variables to store data with meaningful names.

sections.title: Creating Variables
sections.content: In most programming languages, we create variables by giving them a name and a value. Think of it like putting a label on a container and then putting something inside it.

examples.title: Creating Your First Variables
Variables in Python
examples.content:
name = "Alice"
age = 25
is_student = True

print(name)       # Prints: Alice
print(age)        # Prints: 25
print(is_student) # Prints: True

sections.title: Data Types - Different Kinds of Information
sections.content: Just like in real life we have different types of things (numbers, words, true/false), programming languages have different data types to represent different kinds of information.

sections.title: 1. Numbers (Integers and Decimals)
sections.content: Numbers are used for counting, calculating, and measuring. We have whole numbers (integers) and decimal numbers (floats).

examples.title: Working with Numbers

sections.title: 2. Text (Strings)
sections.content: Strings are used to store text - like names, messages, or any sequence of characters. We put text in quotes to tell the computer it's a string.

examples.title: Working with Text

sections.title: 3. True/False (Booleans)
sections.content: Booleans represent yes/no or true/false values. They're perfect for storing information about whether something is on or off, completed or not, etc.

examples.title: Using Booleans

sections.title: 4. Lists (Arrays)
sections.content: Arrays let us store multiple values in a single variable. Think of it like a shopping list where you can store many items under one name.

examples.title: Creating and Using Arrays

sections.title: Variable Naming Rules
sections.content: Good variable names make your code easier to read and understand. Here are some important rules and tips for naming variables.

examples.title: Good vs Bad Variable Names

sections.title: Changing Variable Values
sections.content: Variables are called 'variables' because their values can change! We can update them as our program runs.

examples.title: Updating Variables

sections.title: Why Data Types Matter
sections.content: Understanding data types helps you choose the right tool for the job and avoid common mistakes. Each type has special abilities and limitations.

examples.title: Data Type Surprises
